skill.name: Observability & Monitoring
skill.description: Structured logging, metrics, distributed tracing, and alerting strategies
skill.summary: Structured logging, metrics, distributed tracing, and alerting strategies
skill.author: ArieGoldkin

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and standard observability templates using legitimate libraries (Winston, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry). All network calls are to configurable OTLP endpoints. All file access is to log directories only. No suspicious behavior detected.

content.value_statement: Applications lack visibility into production issues. This skill provides templates for structured logging, metrics collection, distributed tracing, and alerting to achieve full observability across your stack.
actual_capabilities: Configure structured JSON logging with Winston and request correlation
Set up Prometheus metrics with HTTP, database, and cache instrumentation
Implement OpenTelemetry distributed tracing with manual spans
Create health check endpoints for Kubernetes liveness, readiness, and startup probes
Define Prometheus alerting rules with severity-based thresholds
limitations: Does not include dashboard configurations or visualization setup
Requires external observability infrastructure (Prometheus, Jaeger, etc.)
Does not provide log aggregation or metric storage solutions

use_cases.title: Add monitoring to API
use_cases.description: Add structured logging, metrics middleware, and health endpoints to Express API for production visibility.

use_cases.title: Configure alerting rules
use_cases.description: Create Prometheus alerting rules for service downtime, error rates, latency thresholds, and resource usage.

use_cases.title: Implement distributed tracing
use_cases.description: Set up OpenTelemetry auto-instrumentation for HTTP, PostgreSQL, and Redis with manual span support.

prompt_templates.title: Add basic logging
prompt_templates.scenario: Need structured logging in Express API
prompt_templates.prompt: Add structured JSON logging to my Express API using the observability-monitoring skill. Include request correlation IDs and log levels configurable via environment variables.

prompt_templates.title: Create metrics endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a /metrics endpoint with Prometheus instrumentation for HTTP request duration, status codes, and database query metrics using the observability-monitoring skill.

prompt_templates.title: Set up tracing
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure OpenTelemetry distributed tracing for my Node.js service. Auto-instrument Express and PostgreSQL. Export traces to OTLP endpoint configurable via environment variable.

prompt_templates.title: Define alert rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Create Prometheus alerting rules for critical issues: service down (up == 0), high error rate (5xx > 5%), high latency (p95 > 2s), and database connection pool exhaustion.

output_examples.input: Add observability to my Node.js Express API
output: Structured logging configured with Winston (JSON format, request IDs)
Metrics middleware tracking request duration and status codes
OpenTelemetry tracing with auto-instrumentation for HTTP and databases
Prometheus alerting rules for service downtime, error rates, and latency
Configuration via environment variables: LOG_LEVEL, SERVICE_NAME, OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT

best_practices: Use structured JSON logging with correlation IDs to trace requests across services
Implement the RED method (Rate, Errors, Duration) for service-level metrics
Configure alert severity levels with appropriate response time targets
anti_patterns: Avoid string interpolation in logs - use structured key-value pairs
Do not expose sensitive data in log attributes or span attributes
Avoid alerting on symptoms rather than root causes

faq.question: What observability tools are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports Prometheus for metrics, OpenTelemetry for tracing, and Winston for logging. Works with any OTLP-compatible backend.

faq.question: What are the latency overhead costs?
faq.answer: Metrics collection adds minimal overhead. Tracing has 1-3% latency impact with sampling. Logging overhead depends on volume.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing monitoring?
faq.answer: Configure endpoint URLs via environment variables. The templates use standard libraries that integrate with most observability platforms.

faq.question: Is my log data sent to external services?
faq.answer: No. Logs write to local files or stdout. Configure transports to send data to your preferred observability backend.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot missing metrics?
faq.answer: Check the /metrics endpoint returns data. Verify metrics middleware is applied to routes. Ensure registry is initialized before collecting.

faq.question: How does this compare to cloud monitoring services?
faq.answer: This provides self-hosted observability using open standards. You maintain infrastructure but avoid vendor lock-in and per-metric costs.
